skill.name: quality-manager-qmr
skill.description: Senior Quality Manager Responsible Person (QMR) for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides overall quality system responsibility, regulatory compliance oversight, management accountability, and strategic quality leadership. Use for quality system governance, regulatory compliance oversight, management responsibility, and quality strategic planning.

security_audit.summary: AI analysis failed - manual review recommended

content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Overall quality management system oversight and effectiveness monitoring per ISO 13485 Clause 5.5.2
Multi-jurisdictional regulatory compliance tracking including EU MDR 2017/745, FDA QSR 21 CFR 820, and ISO 13485
Management review leadership and strategic quality planning with C-level executives
Regulatory authority interface and relationship management with Notified Bodies and FDA
Quality audit program oversight including internal audits and certification body coordination
Quality strategy development aligned with business objectives and regulatory requirements
Quality performance monitoring and KPI framework development
Quality culture development and organizational quality leadership
limitations: Does not replace the legal responsibilities of a designated QMR within an organization
Does not provide real-time regulatory intelligence or automatic updates on regulatory changes
Cannot execute regulatory submissions to authorities on behalf of the organization
Does not substitute for professional legal or regulatory compliance advice
Cannot physically audit facilities or review documents in real-time

use_cases.title: Preparing for Regulatory Inspection
use_cases.description: Use when preparing your HealthTech or MedTech organization for FDA inspections, Notified Body audits, or regulatory authority reviews. The QMR skill helps identify inspection readiness gaps, coordinate preparation activities, and develop response strategies.
use_cases.target_user: Quality assurance managers, regulatory affairs professionals, and QMRs preparing for audits

use_cases.title: Developing Quality Strategy
use_cases.description: Use when aligning quality management objectives with business strategy. The QMR skill provides frameworks for quality investment prioritization, resource allocation, and competitive quality positioning assessment.
use_cases.target_user: Senior management, quality directors, and organizational leadership

use_cases.title: Leading Management Review Meetings
use_cases.description: Use when preparing for or conducting management review meetings per ISO 13485 Clause 5.6. The QMR skill helps structure agendas, define KPIs, and prepare comprehensive quality performance reports for executive teams.
use_cases.target_user: QMRs, quality managers, and executives responsible for quality oversight

use_cases.title: Conducting Compliance Gap Analysis
use_cases.description: Use when assessing regulatory compliance status across multiple jurisdictions. The QMR skill provides frameworks for evaluating EU MDR, FDA QSR, and ISO 13485 compliance gaps and remediation planning.
use_cases.target_user: Regulatory affairs specialists, quality engineers, and compliance teams

prompt_templates.title: QMR Responsibility Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: As a Senior Quality Manager Responsible Person (QMR), analyze our quality management system and identify areas where we may have gaps in QMR oversight responsibilities per ISO 13485 Clause 5.5.2. Focus on: 1) Quality management system effectiveness monitoring, 2) Regulatory compliance status assessment, 3) Management reporting and communication, 4) Resource adequacy for quality activities. Provide specific recommendations for improvement.
prompt_templates.scenario: Assessing organizational QMR responsibilities and identifying improvement areas

prompt_templates.title: Regulatory Compliance Readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: As a QMR, conduct a readiness assessment for our upcoming regulatory inspection. Our company operates in [JURISDICTIONS] and produces [PRODUCT_TYPES]. Identify: 1) Key documentation that should be inspection-ready, 2) Common findings in our product category, 3) Interview preparation topics for our quality team, 4) Post-inspection follow-up procedures we should have in place.
prompt_templates.scenario: Preparing for regulatory authority inspection or audit

prompt_templates.title: Management Review Preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me prepare a comprehensive management review presentation for our C-level executives. Include: 1) Quality management system performance metrics and trends, 2) Regulatory compliance status and emerging requirements, 3) Customer satisfaction and market feedback analysis, 4) Quality costs and ROI on quality investments, 5) Strategic quality initiatives requiring leadership decision or resource allocation.
prompt_templates.scenario: Preparing quarterly or annual management review materials

output_examples.input: As our QMR, help us prepare for an FDA inspection of our medical device manufacturing facility. What are the key focus areas we should address?
output: FDA Inspection Readiness Framework
1. Quality System Documentation Readiness
- Design History Files (DHF) completeness and organization
- Device Master Records (DMR) accuracy and accessibility
- Device History Records (DHR) traceabilty and completeness
- CAPA system documentation and effectiveness evidence
2. Common FDA Inspection Focus Areas (21 CFR 820)
- CAPA (21 CFR 820.100) - Root cause analysis, corrective actions
- Design Controls (21 CFR 820.30) - Design verification/validation
- Production and Process Controls (21 CFR 820.70)
- Records Management (21 CFR 820.180-184)
3. Interview Preparation for Quality Team
- Know your procedures and how they relate to regulations
- Be able to describe CAPA flow and escalation criteria
- Understand document control and record retention policies
4. Post-Inspection Follow-Up
- Document all FDA communications and findings
- Establish root cause for any observations
- Develop corrective action plans with measurable milestones

output_examples.input: Help me develop quality objectives for our organization that align with ISO 13485 requirements.
output: Quality Objectives Framework per ISO 13485 Clause 5.4.1
SMART Quality Objectives Structure:
1. Quality Management System Effectiveness
- Target: Achieve 95% internal audit procedure compliance rate
- Measurement: Internal audit findings tracking
- Timeline: Quarterly review and annual target reset
2. Regulatory Compliance
- Target: Zero critical findings in regulatory inspections
Measurement: Regulatory inspection findings
- Timeline: Annual assessment with continuous monitoring
3. Customer Satisfaction
- Target: Maintain customer complaint resolution within 30 days
Measurement: Complaint tracking system metrics
- Timeline: Monthly review with quarterly trend analysis
4. Product Quality
- Target: Reduce product nonconformity rate by 15% YoY
Measurement: NCR tracking and trend analysis
- Timeline: Monthly metrics review with quarterly corrective action

best_practices: Integrate the QMR skill into your regular quality management processes rather than using it only during crises or audits
Validate all regulatory compliance recommendations against current official regulatory guidance before implementation
Use the skill to prepare comprehensive documentation packages before management review meetings
Combine the skill's strategic guidance with hands-on quality tools and subject matter expertise
Document how you use the skill's recommendations for traceability and continuous improvement
Regularly review and update quality objectives using the frameworks provided by the skill
anti_patterns: Using the skill to replace designated QMR responsibilities without proper human oversight and accountability
Implementing regulatory compliance recommendations without verifying against current official regulations
Relying solely on the skill for real-time regulatory intelligence instead of monitoring authoritative sources
Using the skill during active regulatory inspections without human QMR presence and leadership
Treating the skill's output as legal advice rather than strategic guidance
Neglecting to document decisions and rationale when following the skill's recommendations

faq.question: What is the difference between this QMR skill and having a human QMR in my organization?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted guidance on QMR responsibilities, regulatory compliance frameworks, quality strategy development, and audit preparation. It does not replace the legal designation of a QMR within your organization, which carries specific regulatory accountability under frameworks like EU MDR and FDA QSR. The skill should be used as a support tool by or under the supervision of your designated QMR.

faq.question: Can this skill help me prepare for both FDA and EU MDR compliance?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill covers multi-jurisdictional regulatory compliance including FDA QSR 21 CFR 820, EU MDR 2017/745, and ISO 13485 certification requirements. It provides frameworks for understanding requirements across jurisdictions, but you should always verify specific compliance requirements against current official regulatory guidance and consult with regulatory affairs specialists for your specific products and markets.

faq.question: How often should I use this skill for quality management activities?
faq.answer: For optimal results, integrate the skill into regular quality management cycles: before management reviews for preparation support, during audit preparation for readiness assessments, when developing quality strategy for frameworks and best practices, and periodically for compliance gap analysis. Consistent use helps build institutional knowledge and improves the quality of guidance over time.

faq.question: Does this skill provide real-time regulatory updates?
faq.answer: No, the skill does not provide real-time regulatory intelligence or automatic updates on regulatory changes. Regulatory requirements and guidance evolve continuously. You should monitor official regulatory authority sources (FDA, EUDAMED, Notified Bodies, etc.) for the latest updates and consult with regulatory affairs professionals for interpretation and impact assessment on your quality management system.
